description: '''Hildur Alice Nilson''' (26 January 1924 – 11 February 2014), known by her stage name '''Alice Babs''', was a Swedish singer.{{sfn|Cook|2005|p=27}} She worked in a wide number of genres – [[Swedish folklore]], Elizabethan songs and opera. While she was best known internationally as a [[jazz]] singer, Babs also competed as Sweden's first annual competition entrant in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1958]]. In 1972 she was named Sweden's [[Hovsångare|Royal Court Singer]], the first non-opera singer as such.
